pullRequest.body:
Formalize IMO 2024 problem 5.

Note that this solution is longer than any of the existing IMO formalizations in either the mathlib archive or compfiles; feel free to golf, where doing so isn't adverse to the role of such formalizations as readable examples. Various definitions using proofs (that certain paths used in an optimal strategy are valid paths) by essentially `split_ifs <;> simp <;> omega` are (subjectively, not counted heartbeats) slow for Lean to process; in those cases, I think the tactics used are a better approach as an example than a faster but lower-level and probably longer proof would be, so rather than making those proofs longer to speed them up it might be better to treat them as examples that might show opportunities for speeding up those tactics.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #18593

./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18473~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18593~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dwrensha.
Fixed.
`last two` -> `last row`?
Fixed.
Would it make more sense to name this `Cell` (or possibly `Coords`)? The name `Board` gives me the wrong idea that this type will contain information about what occupies *all* of the cells.
I've renamed this to `Cell`.

I think this and some of the following definitions become more readable if you first define:
```lean
/-- A row that is neither the first nor the last. -/
abbrev InteriorRow (N : â„•) : Type := (Set.Icc 1 âŸ¨N, by omegaâŸ© : Set (Fin (N + 2)))
```
and then use that when possible.
I've made that change.

golfed a bit:
```diff
@@ -190,19 +190,14 @@ lemma Path.exists_mem_fst_eq (p : Path N) (r : Fin (N + 2)) : âˆƒ c âˆˆ p.cells,
   Â· omega
   Â· exact h
   Â· rcases Nat.eq_zero_or_pos i with hi | hi
-    Â· have h0 : p.cells[0].1 = 0 := by rw [List.getElem_zero, p.head_first_row]
-      have h0' : p.cells[i].1 = 0 := by convert h0
-      simp [h0'] at h
-    Â· suffices decide (r â‰¤ p.cells[i - 1].1) = true by
+    Â· simp only [hi, List.getElem_zero, p.head_first_row, Fin.not_lt_zero] at h
+    Â· suffices r â‰¤ p.cells[i - 1].1 by
         exfalso
         have hi' : i - 1 < i := by omega
-        rw [List.not_of_lt_findIdx hi'] at this
-        simp at this
-      rw [decide_eq_true]
+        exact of_decide_eq_false (List.not_of_lt_findIdx hi') this
       have ha : Adjacent p.cells[i - 1] p.cells[i] := by
         convert List.chain'_iff_get.1 p.valid_move_seq (i - 1) ?_
-        Â· have hi' : i - 1 + 1 = i := by omega
-          simp [hi']
+        Â· simp [Nat.sub_add_cancel hi]
         Â· omega
       exact ha.le_of_lt h
```
Suggested golf applied.

zigazg -> zigzag
(here and below)
Fixed.

We can avoid the need for this `if ... then ... else` and generally make things simpler by switching the order of the calls to `setValue` in `monsterData12`:
```diff
diff --git a/Archive/Imo/Imo2024Q5.lean b/Archive/Imo/Imo2024Q5.lean
index b770670c5d..a8a9ba7825 100644
--- a/Archive/Imo/Imo2024Q5.lean
+++ b/Archive/Imo/Imo2024Q5.lean
@@ -540,48 +540,39 @@ def baseMonsterData (N : â„•) : MonsterData N where
     simp only [Fin.mk.injEq] at h
     simpa using h
 
-/-- Positions for monsters with a specified column in the second row (row 1). -/
-def monsterData1 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) (câ‚ : Fin (N + 1)) : MonsterData N :=
-  (baseMonsterData N).setValue (row1 hN) câ‚
-
-lemma row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData1 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) (câ‚ : Fin (N + 1)) :
-    (1, câ‚) âˆˆ (monsterData1 hN câ‚).monsterCells :=
-  Set.mem_range_self (row1 hN)
-
 /-- Positions for monsters with specified columns in the second and third rows (rows 1 and 2). -/
 def monsterData12 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) (câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)) : MonsterData N :=
-  ((baseMonsterData N).setValue (row1 hN) câ‚).setValue (row2 hN) câ‚‚
+  ((baseMonsterData N).setValue (row2 hN) câ‚‚).setValue (row1 hN) câ‚
 
-lemma monsterData12_apply_row1 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) {câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)} (h : câ‚ â‰  câ‚‚) :
-    monsterData12 hN câ‚ câ‚‚ (row1 hN) = câ‚ := by
+lemma monsterData12_apply_row2 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) {câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)} (h : câ‚ â‰  câ‚‚) :
+    monsterData12 hN câ‚ câ‚‚ (row2 hN) = câ‚‚ := by
   rw [monsterData12, Function.Embedding.setValue_eq_of_ne]
   Â· exact Function.Embedding.setValue_eq _ _ _
   Â· simp only [row1, row2, ne_eq, Subtype.mk.injEq]
     simp only [Fin.ext_iff, Fin.val_one]
     omega
-  Â· rwa [Function.Embedding.setValue_eq]
-
-lemma row2_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) (câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)) :
-    (âŸ¨2, by omegaâŸ©, câ‚‚) âˆˆ (monsterData12 hN câ‚ câ‚‚).monsterCells := by
-  exact Set.mem_range_self (row2 hN)
+  Â· rw [Function.Embedding.setValue_eq]
+    exact h.symm
 
-lemma row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) {câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)} (h : câ‚ â‰  câ‚‚) :
+lemma row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) (câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)) :
     (1, câ‚) âˆˆ (monsterData12 hN câ‚ câ‚‚).monsterCells := by
-  convert Set.mem_range_self (row1 hN)
-  exact (monsterData12_apply_row1 hN h).symm
+  exact Set.mem_range_self (row1 hN)
+
+lemma row2_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) {câ‚ câ‚‚ : Fin (N + 1)} (h : câ‚ â‰  câ‚‚) :
+    (âŸ¨2, by omegaâŸ©, câ‚‚) âˆˆ (monsterData12 hN câ‚ câ‚‚).monsterCells := by
+  convert Set.mem_range_self (row2 hN)
+  exact (monsterData12_apply_row2 hN h).symm
 
 lemma Strategy.not_forcesWinIn_two (s : Strategy N) (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) : Â¬ s.ForcesWinIn 2 := by
   simp only [ForcesWinIn, WinsIn, Set.mem_range, not_forall, not_exists, Option.ne_none_iff_isSome]
   let m1 : Cell N := (s Fin.elim0).findFstEq 1
   let m2 : Cell N := (s ![m1]).findFstEq 2
-  let m : MonsterData N := if m1.2 = m2.2 then monsterData1 hN m1.2 else monsterData12 hN m1.2 m2.2
+  let m : MonsterData N := monsterData12 hN m1.2 m2.2
   have h1r : m1.1 = 1 := Path.findFstEq_fst _ _
   have h2r : m2.1 = 2 := Path.findFstEq_fst _ _
   have h1 : m1 âˆˆ m.monsterCells := by
-    simp_rw [m]
-    split_ifs with h
-    Â· convert row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData1 hN _
-    Â· convert row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 hN h
+    convert row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 hN m1.2 m2.2
+
   have h2 : ((2 : Fin (N + 2)) : â„•) = 2 := Nat.mod_eq_of_lt (by omega : 2 < N + 2)
   refine âŸ¨m, fun i â†¦ ?_âŸ©
   fin_cases i
@@ -590,19 +581,18 @@ lemma Strategy.not_forcesWinIn_two (s : Strategy N) (hN : 2 â‰¤ N) : Â¬ s.Forces
     suffices ((s ![some m1]).firstMonster m).isSome = true by
       rwa [Path.firstMonster_eq_of_findFstEq_mem h1]
     simp_rw [m]
-    split_ifs with h
+    by_cases h : m1.2 = m2.2
     Â· rw [Path.firstMonster_isSome]
-      refine âŸ¨m1, ?_, ?_âŸ©
-      Â· have h' : m1 = (âŸ¨(((2 : Fin (N + 2)) : â„•) - 1 : â„•), by omegaâŸ©, m2.2) := by
-          simp [h2, Prod.ext_iff, h1r, h2r, h]
-        nth_rw 2 [h']
-        refine Path.findFstEq_fst_sub_one_mem _ ?_
-        rw [ne_eq, Fin.ext_iff, h2]
-        norm_num
-      Â· convert row1_mem_monsterCells_monsterData1 hN _
+      refine âŸ¨m1, ?_, h1âŸ©
+      have h' : m1 = (âŸ¨(((2 : Fin (N + 2)) : â„•) - 1 : â„•), by omegaâŸ©, m2.2) := by
+        simp [h2, Prod.ext_iff, h1r, h2r, h]
+      nth_rw 2 [h']
+      refine Path.findFstEq_fst_sub_one_mem _ ?_
+      rw [ne_eq, Fin.ext_iff, h2]
+      norm_num
     Â· rw [Path.firstMonster_isSome]
       refine âŸ¨m2, Path.findFstEq_mem_cells _ _, ?_âŸ©
-      convert row2_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 hN m1.2 m2.2 using 1
+      convert row2_mem_monsterCells_monsterData12 hN h using 1
       simp [Prod.ext_iff, h2r, Fin.ext_iff, h2]
 
 lemma Strategy.ForcesWinIn.three_le {s : Strategy N} {k : â„•} (hf : s.ForcesWinIn k)

```
Applied.
Oops -- my last suggested diff added this blank line, which shouldn't be here.
Fixed, I hope (I think you were referring to a different blank line, in the middle of a proof).

Superfluous parentheses:
`some ((1, m (row1 hN))) ` -> `some (1, m (row1 hN))`
Fixed.

Have you considered using `SimpleGraph.Walk` instead of defining your own `Path` like this? (I'm not asking you to rewrite this PR, because I expect that would be a lot of work; I'm just curious whether you had any thoughts about how possible it would be to use that existing API.)

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/fd92bc36215a9632f15c6482fb0132d24e6c49ab/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Walk.lean#L45-L56

One advantage that I imagine `SimpleGraph.Walk` might have is that it could make it easier to construct walks by concatenating smaller walks. That might allow more compositional reasoning, compared to the `Path.ofFn` logic that you have here.

this `simp only` can be replaced by the smaller
```lean
dsimp only [Nat.reduceAdd, Nat.reduceDiv, Fin.mk_one] at hm
```
Done.

The above three lines can be replaced by
```
  rw [or_iff_not_imp_left]
  intro h
```
which to my eyes is easier to read.
Done.

a little bit simpler:
```diff
-  rcases lt_trichotomy (p.cells[i]).1 r with h | h | h
-  Â· omega
-  Â· exact h
+  rcases hig.lt_or_eq.symm with h | h
+  Â· exact h.symm
```
Changed. If you have any more such small local simplifications, I suggest pushing them directly to the branch.

pullRequest.title: feat(Archive/Imo): IMO 2024 Q5

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dwrensha.
